Title: RedisWannaMine Cryptocurrency-Mining Operation Found Targeting Servers with EternalBlue
Intro: A new cryptocurrency-mining operation they named RedisWannaMine was uncovered targeting database and application servers by exploiting the notorious EternalBlue.

Title: Large-Scale Heist of Cryptocurrency Exchange Binance Fails
Intro: Users of cryptocurrency exchange Binance began noticing irregular trading on the platform a few days ago. An investigation revealed an organized and large-scale scheme to transfer bitcoin to several malicious actors. Automatic alarms were triggered and Binance

Title: Lazarus Campaign and LoopX Scam Show That Cryptocurrency Industry Still Fraught With Dangers
Intro: Two cryptocurrency incidents made the news recently: one concerning a new campaign from the threat actor known as the Lazarus Group, and the other involving a scam by one of the many new cryptocurrency startups.

Title: Coinhive Attacks and Alleged Bitgrail Losses Highlight Cryptocurrency Security Issues
Intro: Two cryptocurrency-related security incidents occurred during the past couple of days, adding to the rising number of attacks that target digital currency.

Title: OSX.CreativeUpdate macOS Cryptocurrency Miner Distributed via MacUpdate
Intro: A new cryptocurrency-mining malware was uncovered targeting macOS systems: — OSX.CreativeUpdate Here's what you need to know.

Title: Coincheck Suffers Biggest Hack in Cryptocurrency History; Experty Users Tricked into Buying False ICO
Intro: Coincheck suffers a massive cryptocurrency hack while Experty users are tricked into buying a false ICO. What does this mean for the safety of cryptocurrency investors?

Title: Attackers Use Fake SpriteCoin Cryptocurrency to Lure Users into Downloading Ransomware
Intro: A recent campaign was found using social engineering methods to take advantage of the increasing hype and visibility of cryptocurrencies via a fictional cryptocurrency called SpriteCoin, which is used as a ransomware lure for unsuspecting users.

Title: Electroneum (ETN) Cryptocurrency Targeted by Webminer Delivered via Malicious Advertisements
Intro: Trend Micro observed a recent spate of attacks designed to deliver a webminer for the Electroneum (ETN) cryptocurrency.

Title: Security 101: The Impact of Cryptocurrency-Mining Malware
Intro: As cryptocurrencies like bitcoin are more widely used, so will the threats that cybercriminals use to abuse it. Here’s a closer look at cryptocurrency-mining malware—their emergence in the threat landscape, impact, and some countermeasures against them.

Title: Magento-Based Websites Hacked to Steal Credit Card Data and Install Cryptocurrency-Mining Malware
Intro: Security researchers reported that at least 1,000 websites running on the Magento platform were targeted via brute-force attacks to steal credit card data and install cryptocurrency-mining malware.

Title: “Zealot” Campaign and the Lazarus Group End the Year With Cryptocurrency Mining Attacks
Intro: With cryptocurrency prices hitting new highs recently, it’s no surprise that cybercriminals are starting to become more aggressive in terms of profiting from these digital currencies.

Title: By the Numbers: Are Your Smart Home Devices Being Used as Cryptocurrency Miners?
Intro: Our data shows a huge increase in home network attacks attempting cryptocurrency mining activities. This spike coincides with the recent rise in the value of major cryptocurrencies.

Title: South Korean Cryptocurrency Exchange Bithumb Hacked
Intro: One of the largest cryptocurrency exchange platforms in the world was hacked, with thousands of user accounts compromised.

Title: Ransomware Recap: New Disguises and a Change of Cryptocurrency
Intro: This week we see ransomware disguise itself as a PC game, a popular sci-fi hero also makes an appearance, and new cryptocurrency starts to gain traction.

Title: Coverity Scan Hacked, Abused for Cryptocurrency Mining
Intro: Synopsys tells customers to change their passwords for Coverity Scan after the service was hacked and abused for cryptocurrency mining  [Read More]

Title: Cryptocurrency Miners Not Uncommon on Industrial Systems
Intro: Cryptocurrency mining malware is not uncommon on industrial systems, according to several cybersecurity firms  [Read More]

Title: Monero Miner Sends Cryptocurrency to North Korean University
Intro: An application compiled just weeks ago was found to be an installer for a Monero miner designed to send the mined currency to a North Korean university, AlienVault reports.  [Read More]

Title: SambaCry Flaw Exploited to Deliver Cryptocurrency Miner
Intro: Recently patched Samba flaw known as EternalRed and SambaCry exploited to deliver a cryptocurrency miner  [Read More]

Title: Linux Malware Targets Raspberry Pi for Cryptocurrency Mining
Intro: A piece of Linux malware dubbed MulDrop targets Raspberry Pi devices and abuses them for cryptocurrency mining  [Read More]

Title: Sundown Exploit Kit Variant Distributes Cryptocurrency Miner
Intro: A variant of the Sundown exploit kit (EK) was recently seen using a different infrastructure than previously known and distributing a cryptocurrency mining application.  [Read More]

Title: Cryptocurrency-related Spam Mails Currently On The Rise
Intro: Cryptocurrency is the hot new topic nowadays, so it's no surprise that cybercriminals will start to use it as a way to get users to click on their malicious spam mail. For the past few days, we have seen an increase in the number of cryptocurrency-related spam emails.Read more

Title: ICOs: The Lawless Land of Cryptocurrency Fundraising
Intro: From raising $30 million in 30 seconds to being endorsed by Paris Hilton or vanishing into thin air: anything is possible in the risky new world of cryptocurrency fundraising, but regulators are lurking.  [Read More]

Title: C4, BitGo Publish Draft of CryptoCurrency Security Standard
Intro: A draft of the CryptoCurrency Security Standard (CCSS) has been made available for public discussion by C4 and BitGo.  [Read More]

Title: Cryptocurrency Mining Malware Hits Monitoring Systems at European Water Utility
Intro: Cryptocurrency mining malware worked its way onto four servers connected to an operational technology (OT) network at a wastewater facility in Europe, industrial cybersecurity firm Radiflow told SecurityWeek Wednesday.  [Read More]

Title: NAS Devices Used to Spread Cryptocurrency Mining Malware
Intro: A malware that uses infected computers to mine Monero cryptocurrency leverages NAS devices for distribution  [Read More]

Title: Go-Based Linux Trojan Used for Cryptocurrency Mining
Intro: A new Linux Trojan developed in Go has been used by cybercriminals for cryptocurrency mining  [Read More]
